title: Hamstring
summary:
In human anatomy, a hamstring (/ˈhæmstrɪŋ/) is any one of the three posterior thigh muscles in between the hip and the knee (from medial to lateral: semimembranosus, semitendinosus and biceps femoris).[3] The hamstrings are susceptible to injury.[4]
In quadrupeds, the hamstring is the single large tendon found behind the knee or comparable area.
